description_txt: stated on March 11, 2011 in an oped column.:
quote_txt: The Texas Constitution "still contains Jim Crow provisions about the poll tax and restrictions on women having the right to vote."

description_txt: stated on March 15, 2011 in a letter to President Barack Obama:
quote_txt: Says the majority of Americans support gay marriage.

description_txt: stated on February 25, 2011 in a column.:
quote_txt: The House budget plan proposes "the largest discretionary spending cut in history."

description_txt: stated on January 25, 2011 in testimony to Florida House Business and Consumer Affairs Subcommittee.:
quote_txt: "Florida is one of only three states that require licenses for commercial interior designers."

description_txt: stated on March 9, 2011 in a newspaper ad:
quote_txt: Says it has offered $12 million in savings through 2011 and $184 million in savings over the next 25 years in contract negotiations with the City of Milwaukee.

description_txt: stated on March 14, 2011 in a conference call.:
quote_txt: Says the state’s rainy day fund is "our insurance policy against a major natural disaster."

description_txt: stated on March 3, 2011 in a House committee hearing:
quote_txt: "Lake Erie supports nearly 10 percent of Ohio's jobs and generates $750 million in state and local taxes."

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2011 in a legislative debate:
quote_txt: Say easing restrictions on selling alcohol on Sundays will result in more traffic crashes and fatalities.

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2011 in comments before a House subcommittee:
quote_txt: Says his bill, HB 97, would prevent the use of taxpayer dollars on abortions.

description_txt: stated on February 22, 2011 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: "We have over 25 million people who live in Texas and less than 2 percent of them have" concealed handgun licenses.

description_txt: stated on February 22, 2011 in an interview on CNN:
quote_txt: Says Texas colleges and universities may opt to allow guns on campuses.

description_txt: stated on March 15, 2011 in a press statement.:
quote_txt: A proposed revenue smart cap "gives Floridians a voice, requiring a 60 percent vote by citizens in order to impose a new tax, fee, license, fine, charge or assessment."

description_txt: stated on March 13, 2011 in an interview on Fox News Sunday:
quote_txt: "Twenty percent of our electricity currently comes from nuclear power plants. I think there are 104 in the United States, two of them around the coast in California."

description_txt: stated on January 19, 2011 in a telephone news conference:
quote_txt: Says that Republicans "bragged about how every bill was going to be paid for, right from the beginning" and that the first vote, the repeal of health care reform, violated that rule.

description_txt: stated on January 17, 2011 in a newsletter to constituents:
quote_txt: Building and running the Atlanta Streetcar is projected to create 1,399 jobs.

description_txt: stated on March 4, 2011 in a press release.:
quote_txt: "Put simply, less government spending equals more private sector jobs."

description_txt: stated on February 16, 2011 in a column:
quote_txt: Gov. Rick Perry "used $3.2 billion in stimulus dollars for schools to plug other holes in his budget."

description_txt: stated on March 13, 2011 in an interview on "This Week with Christiane Amanpour.":
quote_txt: Federal spending is "all discretionary, other than interest on the national debt. Social Security is discretionary. We have the discretion to change the law. Same is true with Medicare and Medicaid."

description_txt: stated on March 1, 2011 in an interview on C-SPAN:
quote_txt: "There are corporations in this nation, some of the biggest corporations in this nation, who do not pay taxes."

description_txt: stated on March 11, 2011 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "Oil production from federal waters in the Gulf of Mexico reached an all-time high" in 2010.

description_txt: stated on March 11, 2011 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "Last year, American oil production reached its highest level since 2003."

description_txt: stated on February 24, 2011 in a political advertisement:
quote_txt: "2008: Unions Spent $400 Million to Elect Obama."

description_txt: stated on March 11, 2011 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "For the first time in more than a decade, imports accounted for less than half of (the oil) we consumed."

description_txt: stated on March 9, 2011 in a television ad:
quote_txt: In fighting collective bargaining changes, Democrats are trying to "protect a system that pays unionized government workers 42 percent more than non-union workers."

description_txt: stated on March 2, 2011 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: "Georgia still has one of the richest programs in terms of scholarships for students to go to college."

description_txt: stated on February 22, 2011 in comments before a state Senate committee.:
quote_txt: The American Academy of Pediatrics "supports banning guns."

description_txt: stated on March 1, 2011 in testimony to a House subcommittee:
quote_txt: Says that President Obama said in 2008 that his proposed greenhouse gas regulations "will bankrupt" anyone who wants to build a new coal-fired power plant.

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2011 in a letter to fellow Members of Congress:
quote_txt: A bill that would halt the EPA from regulating greenhouse gases would help "stop rising gas prices."

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2011 in a C-SPAN interview:
quote_txt: "We now work the longest hours of any people around the world."

description_txt: stated on March 10, 2011 in comments on the state Senate floor.:
quote_txt: "Seven of the 10" school districts with the lowest graduation rate for African-American boys in the country are in Florida.
